results.title: Growing
results.brief_description: This program shows how babies grow from infancy to adulthood. Highlights the changes that occur during babyhood, childhood and puberty. Provides interviews with adolescents to emphasize the emotional and physical changes that occur at puberty.

results.title: Grove music
results.brief_description: The Grove - better known as London’s Notting Hill Gate district associated with a history of black militancy. But amid the violence has emerged a music which gives expression to the culture and politics of black youth. Bands appearing in this film include: Inity, Aswad, Sons of Jah, Brimstone and Junior Brown.

results.title: Groupthink
results.creator_credit: Steven Katten, Communication Research Materials Production and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Group Dynamics”.
Analyses the dynamics of group decision-making and explores the processes which inhibit creativity and foster “groupthink”.

results.title: Grouping living things
results.brief_description: How do we classify the diversity of life? An animated Linneaus narrates the history of classification from Aristotle to his Systems Naturae, Phylum, and Class Order family. The film briefly explains how a scientist classifies and organism and gives many examples. Suitable for use in a general science course.

results.title: Grouping children: some alternatives
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: Provides information on how five Victorian primary schools make decisions about the grouping of their children into composite, multi-age, family, subject specific, cross-age, and multicultural groupings.

results.title: Group training
results.creator_credit: Victori Menzies, Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures

results.title: Group Teaching -the Use of a Theme
results.brief_description: To stimulate discussion about group tuition. This film shows one group and a staff tutor plus a volunteer tutor choosing a theme and all the activities it leads to with training a particular group.

results.title: Group productivity (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ron Underwood, Janice M Reynolds and CRM Productions
results.brief_description: Divides group development into three phases: Orientation, Power Distribution and Tasking, Team Production and Feedback. Demonstrates the delicate balance between tasking and nurturing for each phase and gives examples of coping and motivational strategies useful in daily living.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Underwood, Janice M Reynolds and CRM Productions
